summary: This document is an internal communication from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding an inmate's medical condition. It references a decision to transport an inmate via BOP vehicle due to significant vision loss, and notes that the Warden was not previously informed.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: Author of the correspondence, instructing staff to notify the Warden about incidents and referencing being in SHU (Special Housing Unit).

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Mentioned as being very particular about notifications and not having been informed about the inmate's situation.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: Referenced as the source of the medical assessment regarding the inmate's vision, recommending transport.

connections.description: The Associate Warden reports to the Warden and is responsible for ensuring the Warden is notified about incidents.
Dr. provided a medical assessment that led to a decision requiring notification of the Warden.

events.title: Medical Transport Decision
events.description: A decision was made to transport an inmate via BOP vehicle due to a significant amount of decreased vision, as assessed by a doctor.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated August 16, 2019, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
It references an inmate with 'significant amount of decreased vision' requiring transport via BOP vehicle.
The Associate Warden notes the Warden is 'very particular about notifications' and had not been previously informed.
The correspondence indicates internal prison procedures regarding inmate medical issues and notification chains.
